code: @Manual{,   title = {WPD: World Panel Data: A Macroeconomic Data Visualization and Analysis Toolkit},   author = {Benjamin Peeters},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.11},   url = {https://benjaminpeeters.github.io/WPD}, }

title: World Panel Data: A Macroeconomic Data Visualization and Analysis Toolkit
text: WPD (World Panel Data) R package simplifies access visualization global panel data major international organizations. serves bridge publicly available datasets researchers, making easier work cross-country panel data.

title: World Panel Data: A Macroeconomic Data Visualization and Analysis Toolkit
text: Unified Data Access: Load manipulate data multiple sources single interface Data Harmonization: Standardized country names ISO3 codes across sources Frequency matching (quarterly yearly vice versa) Multiple interpolation methods Seasonal adjustments quarterly data Group aggregation various methods Automatic data validation cleaning Time series plots multiple customization options Scatter plots statistical annotations Bar plots flexible grouping Support multi-panel layouts Export various formats (PNG, PDF)

title: World Panel Data: A Macroeconomic Data Visualization and Analysis Toolkit
text: Visit Documentation Website comprehensive guides tutorials. recommend starting : Introduction Data Loading Basic Time Series Plotting Multi-Variable Plots Scatter Plot Features Click complete function reference.

title: World Panel Data: A Macroeconomic Data Visualization and Analysis Toolkit
World Panel Data: A Macroeconomic Data Visualization and Analysis Toolkit
text: R version ≥ 3.5.0 Disk space: ~100MB installation Runtime memory: 15-50MB (depending data loaded) Dependencies: ggplot2 (≥3.4.0, <3.5.0), scales, patchwork, zoo, seasonal

title: World Panel Data: A Macroeconomic Data Visualization and Analysis Toolkit
code: library(WPD)  # Load data for G7 countries data <- wp_data(   ISO = "G7",   formula = c("GDP_C", "CU_C/GDP_C*100"),   variable = c("GDP", "Current Account"),   years = c(2000, 2023) )  # Create a time series plot wp_plot_series(data,                 y_axis = c("Billion USD", "% of GDP"),                right_axis = "Current Account",                title = "GDP and Current Account in G7 Countries")

title: World Panel Data: A Macroeconomic Data Visualization and Analysis Toolkit
text: Browse available data using wp_info() function:
code: # View all available variables wp_info()  # View only quarterly data wp_info("Q")  # View only yearly data wp_info("Y")

title: World Panel Data: A Macroeconomic Data Visualization and Analysis Toolkit
code: # Complex data manipulation example data <- wp_data(   ISO = c("EU", "BRICS"),  # Multiple country groups   formula = "100*CU_C/GDP_C",  # Custom formula   years = c(2000, 2023),   adjust_seasonal = TRUE,  # Apply seasonal adjustment   aggregate_iso = "Mean",  # Average across countries   aggregate_period = "CAGR"  # Calculate compound growth )

title: World Panel Data: A Macroeconomic Data Visualization and Analysis Toolkit
code: # Multi-panel time series with events events <- data.frame(   Event = c("Global Financial Crisis", "Covid-19 Pandemic"),   Date = as.Date(c("2008-09-15", "2020-03-11")) )  wp_plot_series(data,                key_dates = events,                area = TRUE,  # Create area plot                reference = TRUE)  # Add data sources

title: World Panel Data: A Macroeconomic Data Visualization and Analysis Toolkit
code: # Scatter plot with regression and grouping wp_plot_scatter(data,                 color = "Region",                 interpolation = "Spline",                 r_squared = 3,  # Show full equation                 ISO = "Both")  # Show both points and labels

code: in_adjust_columns_to_frequency(   data,   frequencies,   symbols,   matching_yq = "Q2Y",   interpolation_method = "Linear",   verbose = TRUE,   debug = FALSE )

title: Aggregate Data Across Countries — in_aggregate_countries
text: Internal function aggregates panel data across countries using various statistical methods, optional quartile calculations. Used : wp_data Uses: None Features: Multiple aggregation methods (Sum/Mean/Median) Optional quartile calculations NA handling options Group-wise processing ISO code generation aggregates Reference preservation Date consistency maintenance Automatic warning generation

title: Aggregate Data Across Countries — in_aggregate_countries
code: in_aggregate_countries(df, method = "Median", quartile = FALSE, na.rm = TRUE)

what: Aggregate Data Across Time Periods — in_aggregate_time

what: Convert Country Name to ISO3 Code — wp_ctry2iso
title: Convert Country Name to ISO3 Code — wp_ctry2iso
text: Converts country names corresponding ISO3 codes. function uses hierarchical matching strategy: first trying exact match, prefix partial matches input long enough, avoiding matches common words.

title: Convert Country Name to ISO3 Code — wp_ctry2iso
Convert Country Name to ISO3 Code — wp_ctry2iso
text: country_name Character vector containing country names convert. function accepts various formats spellings, including: Official names (e.g., "United States America") Common names (e.g., "United States", "USA") Historical names (e.g., "Burma" Myanmar) Names special characters (e.g., "Côte d'Ivoire") Names abbreviations (e.g., "Rep." Republic) verbose Logical, whether print information matching method used exact match fails (default: TRUE) min_letter Integer, minimum number letters required prefix partial matching attempts (default: 3). used exact match fails.

title: Convert Country Name to ISO3 Code — wp_ctry2iso
text: Character vector length country_name containing ISO3 codes. Returns NA entries match found, warning message verbose=TRUE.

title: Convert Country Name to ISO3 Code — wp_ctry2iso
text: function performs matching following order: Normalizes input name (converts lowercase, removes special characters, standardizes spacing) Attempts exact match normalized names exact match fails input length >= min_letter: Tries prefix match (input matches start country name) Tries partial match (input contained within country name) Skips matching common words like "United", "Republic", etc. verbose=TRUE, informs user successful prefix/partial match

title: Convert Country Name to ISO3 Code — wp_ctry2iso
code: # Single country wp_ctry2iso("France")  # Returns "FRA" #> France  #>  "FRA"   # Multiple countries wp_ctry2iso(c("France", "Germany", "Italy"))  # Returns c("FRA", "DEU", "ITA") #>  France Germany   Italy  #>   "FRA"   "DEU"   "ITA"   # Mixed cases with some partial matches wp_ctry2iso(c("fra", "Deutsche", "Kingdom"))   #> Error in print_debug(sprintf("ISO code for country name '%s' (%s) not found. NA value returned.",     one_country, normalize_name(one_country)), verbose, FALSE,     "warning"): could not find function "print_debug"

what: Load and Process World Panel Data — wp_data
title: Load and Process World Panel Data — wp_data
text: Loads processes data comprehensive panel database containing economic, financial, development indicators. function handles data filtering, frequency adjustments, aggregation, seasonal adjustments. Memory usage optimized loading data demand (approximately 15-50MB execution).

title: Load and Process World Panel Data — wp_data
code: wp_data(   ISO,   formula,   variable = NULL,   years,   adjust_seasonal = FALSE,   window_seasadj = NULL,   matching_yq = "Q2Y",   interpolation_method = "Linear",   aggregate_iso = NULL,   aggregate_period = NULL,   quartile = FALSE,   na.rm = TRUE,   reference = TRUE,   country_names = FALSE,   clean = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE,   debug = FALSE )

title: Load and Process World Panel Data — wp_data
text: ISO character vector; ISO 3-letter country codes category names: - Individual countries (e.g., "USA", "CHN") - Categories (e.g., "CTR_LDR", "BRICS", "AFRICA") - Category exclusions using hyphen (e.g., "CTR_LDR - USA") See wp_get_category() available categories. formula character vector; mathematical expressions using Symbol codes: - Simple variables (e.g., "GDP_C") - Calculations basic operators (e.g., "100*CU_C/GDP_C") - Multiple formulas vector - Basic operators: + - * / ( ) Division zero handled, use caution. variable character vector NULL; names formula outputs (Column Variable): - Must match length formula provided - Used output labeling plotting Default NULL, using formula names. years numeric vector length 2; year range; c(start_year, end_year): - First element: start year - Second element: end year Data availability varies country/indicator. adjust_seasonal logical (TRUE/FALSE); apply seasonal adjustment: - TRUE: adjust quarterly data using STL decomposition - affects quarterly data (effect annual) Default FALSE. window_seasadj numeric NULL (= 7); window seasonal adjustment: - Controls smoothing STL decomposition - Larger values = smoothing - used adjust_seasonal = TRUE Default 7. matching_yq character; method handling mixed frequencies: - "Q2Y": convert quarterly yearly - "Y2Q": convert yearly quarterly Default "Q2Y". interpolation_method character; method Y2Q conversion: - "None": repeat yearly value - "Linear": linear interpolation - "Linear-Scale": scaled linear interpolation used matching_yq = "Y2Q". aggregate_iso character NULL; method country aggregation: - "Sum": sum values across countries - "Mean": average values across countries - "Median": median values across countries - NULL: aggregation aggregate_period character NULL; method time aggregation: - "Sum": sum period - "Mean"/"Median": central tendency - "SD": standard deviation - "Growth": period--period growth - "CAGR": compound annual growth rate - "GeoMean": geometric mean - NULL: aggregation quartile logical; include quartile calculations: - TRUE: add first/third quartiles aggregations - used aggregate_iso aggregate_period specified Default FALSE. na.rm logical; handle missing values aggregations: - TRUE: exclude NA values - FALSE: return NA value NA Default TRUE. reference logical; include data source citations: - TRUE: add Reference column output Default TRUE. country_names logical; include full country names: - TRUE: add Country column names ISO codes Default FALSE. clean logical; remove rows NA values: - TRUE: remove NA rows final output Default TRUE. verbose logical; print processing information: - TRUE: show progress warnings Default TRUE. debug logical; print detailed debugging information: - TRUE: show technical details Default FALSE.

title: Load and Process World Panel Data — wp_data
text: data.frame containing: ISO: 3-letter country codes Date: time period (YYYY YYYYQN format) Variable: indicator names formula/variable Value: calculated values Reference: data sources (reference=TRUE) Country: country names (country_names=TRUE)

title: Load and Process World Panel Data — wp_data
text: function processes data several steps: Validates inputs resolves country categories Loads required data (quarterly/yearly) demand Extracts symbols formulas filters data Handles frequency mismatches (Q2Y Y2Q conversion) Evaluates formulas country Performs requested aggregations Applies seasonal adjustments specified Cleans formats output Memory usage optimized : Loading data needed Filtering required columns early Processing one formula time Clearing intermediate objects Data Validation Error Handling: Missing data warnings country/variable Automatic date range adjustment requested years unavailable Minimum observations check seasonal adjustment (16 required) Warnings inappropriate aggregation requests (e.g., growth rates negative values) Variable Types Units: Stock variables: measured point time (e.g., reserves, debt) Flow variables: measured period (e.g., GDP, trade) Index variables: base year representations (various base years available) Percentage variables: bounded ratios IMF Balance Payments data, quarterly values multiplied 4 represent annualized flows, ensuring consistency yearly data Common Data Patterns: World Bank (WB) indicators: _ZS suffix: ratios expressed percentages _CD suffix: current US dollars _KD suffix: constant dollars _XD suffix: indices _PC suffix: per capita values _FE/_MA suffixes: female/male specific indicators IMF Balance Payments (BOP): _C suffix: current prices _R suffix: real/constant prices (base year) o/prefixes: outward/inward flows DI/POR/OI suffixes: direct investment/portfolio/investment E/D suffixes: equity/debt components Natural Disasters (EMDAT): DIS prefix: disaster-related indicators _AFF/_DEATH/_DMG suffixes: affected people/fatalities/economic damage BIO/CLIM/GEO/HYDRO prefixes: biological/climatic/geological/hydrological disasters Financial Market Data (BIS): CRED prefix: credit-related indicators _ALL/_BANK prefixes: sectors/banking sector _CD/_KN/_ZS suffixes: USD/local currency/percentage GDP specialized databases (JST, KOF, etc.) consistent naming patterns documented respective sources.

title: Load and Process World Panel Data — wp_data
text: Variables formulas refer Symbol codes underlying database. Users understand economic/financial meaning variables units performing calculations.

title: Load and Process World Panel Data — wp_data
code: # Basic usage - GDP ratio for one country data <- wp_data(   ISO = "USA",   formula = "100*CU_C/GDP_C",   variable = "Current Account (% GDP)",   years = c(2000, 2023) ) #>  [Step 1] Input Validation.  #>  [Step 2] Data Filtering (ISO codes, Symbols, and Years).  #> Error in in_load_frequency_data(frequency = "Q", verbose = verbose): Data file DATA_Q.RData not found  # Multiple countries and indicators with aggregation data <- wp_data(   ISO = c("CHN", "JPN", "KOR"),   formula = c("EXg_C/GDP_C", "IMg_C/GDP_C"),   variable = c("Exports", "Imports"),   years = c(2010, 2023),   adjust_seasonal = TRUE,   aggregate_iso = "Mean" ) #>  [Step 1] Input Validation.  #>  [Step 2] Data Filtering (ISO codes, Symbols, and Years).  #> Error in in_load_frequency_data(frequency = "Q", verbose = verbose): Data file DATA_Q.RData not found  # Using categories with exclusions data <- wp_data(   ISO = "CTR_LDR - USA",   formula = "FA_C/GDP_C",   years = c(1990, 2023),   adjust_seasonal = TRUE,   aggregate_period = "Growth" ) #>  [Step 0] Get ISO codes for ISO codes.  #>   ---  ISO3(5): DEU FRA GBR ITA JPN  #>  [Step 1] Input Validation.  #>  [Step 2] Data Filtering (ISO codes, Symbols, and Years).  #> Error in in_load_frequency_data(frequency = "Q", verbose = verbose): Data file DATA_Q.RData not found  # Mixed frequency handling data <- wp_data(   ISO = "DEU",   formula = c("GDP_R_2015_Y", "CU_C"),   years = c(2015, 2023),   matching_yq = "Y2Q",   interpolation_method = "Linear" ) #>  [Step 0] Get ISO codes for ISO codes.  #>   ---  ISO3(1): DEU  #>  [Step 1] Input Validation.  #>  [Step 2] Data Filtering (ISO codes, Symbols, and Years).  #> Error in in_load_frequency_data(frequency = "Q", verbose = verbose): Data file DATA_Q.RData not found

what: Convert ISO Code to Country Information — wp_from_iso
title: Convert ISO Code to Country Information — wp_from_iso
text: Returns specified information countries based ISO3 codes. function accepts vector ISO codes returns corresponding information based specified option.

title: Convert ISO Code to Country Information — wp_from_iso
Convert ISO Code to Country Information — wp_from_iso
text: iso Character vector ISO3 country codes opt Character string specifying type information return. Options: "Name": Country names "ISO2": ISO2 country codes "Region": Major geographical regions (AFRICA, AMERICAS, ASIA, EUROPE, OCEANIA) "Subregion": Detailed geographical regions (e.g., NORTH_AFRICA, WEST_ASIA) "Center-Periphery": Economic category (CTR_LDR, CTR_FOL, SMP_LDR, SMP_FOL, PERI) "Oil": Hydrocarbon status (HYD_EXP, HYD_IMP, NA) "NaturalRent": Natural resource status (NRS_REN NA) "Category": categories country belongs

title: Convert ISO Code to Country Information — wp_from_iso
text: character vector length input iso vector containing requested information. "Category" option, returns character vector categories ISO code. "ISO2" option, returns ISO2 codes (e.g., "US" "USA"). Returns NA countries found specified category invalid ISO codes.

title: Convert ISO Code to Country Information — wp_from_iso
code: # Get country names wp_from_iso(c("USA", "FRA", "DEU"), "Name") #>             USA             FRA             DEU  #> "United States"        "France"       "Germany"   # Get ISO2 codes wp_from_iso(c("USA", "GBR", "FRA"), "ISO2")  # Returns c("US", "GB", "FR") #>  USA  GBR  FRA  #> "US" "GB" "FR"   # Get regions wp_from_iso(c("CHN", "BRA"), "Region") #>        CHN        BRA  #>     "ASIA" "AMERICAS"   # Get oil status wp_from_iso(c("SAU", "USA", "RUS"), "Oil")  # Returns c("HYD_EXP", NA, "HYD_EXP") #>       SAU       USA       RUS  #> "HYD_EXP"        NA "HYD_EXP"   # Get economic categories wp_from_iso(c("USA", "CHN", "ETH"), "Center-Periphery") #>       USA       CHN       ETH  #> "CTR_LDR" "SMP_LDR"    "PERI"

title: Get Countries Belonging to Specified Categories — wp_get_category

what: Create Bar Plots with Statistical Indicators — wp_plot_bar
title: Create Bar Plots with Statistical Indicators — wp_plot_bar
text: Creates bar plots comparing values across countries, support mean latest values, statistical indicators (range, median), various visual customizations including color grouping value labels. function automatically determines appropriate plot type based number indicators specified parameters.

title: Create Bar Plots with Statistical Indicators — wp_plot_bar
code: wp_plot_bar(   data,   y_axis = NULL,   type = "Mean",   order = "Variable",   show_values = "Bottom",   show_year = 1,   show_range = TRUE,   show_median = TRUE,   color = "Subregion",   filename = NULL,   print = TRUE,   legend = TRUE,   reference = TRUE,   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   subfig_title = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE,   debug = FALSE,   size = NULL,   base_size = 16 )

title: Create Bar Plots with Statistical Indicators — wp_plot_bar
text: data data.frame must contain following columns: - ISO: ISO 3-letter country codes (required) - Date: dates Date format (required) - Variable: indicator names (required) - Value: numeric values (required) - Country: country names (optional, auto-generated ISO missing) - Reference: source citations (required reference=TRUE) y_axis Single string, TRUE, FALSE, NULL: - String: y-axis label - TRUE: use Variable name label - FALSE/NULL: axis label type Controls value display: - "Mean": average time period (default) - "Last": recent value Statistical indicators (range, median) adjust accordingly. order Controls bar ordering: - "Variable": order value (default) - "Alphabetical": order country name - Numeric: order nth variable (multi-indicator plots) - TRUE: "Variable" - FALSE: "Alphabetical" show_values Controls value label position: - "Bottom": labels bars - "Top": labels bars - FALSE: labels Default "Bottom". show_year Controls year display labels: - 0: year - 1: short year format (YY) - 2: full year format (YYYY) applies type="Last". Default 1. show_range Logical; whether show min-max range: - TRUE: adds range indicators - FALSE: range indicators Default TRUE. show_median Logical; whether show median value: - TRUE: adds median markers type="Mean" - FALSE: median markers - Ignored type="Last" Default TRUE. color Controls bar coloring scheme: single indicator: - "Subregion": colors geographical subregion (default) - "Region": colors continent/major region - "Center-Periphery": colors economic classification - "Hydrocarbon": colors hydrocarbon exporter/importer status multiple indicators: - "Variable": different color per indicator - FALSE/NULL: gray bars filename Character string saving plots: - Specify name without extension - Plots saved PNG PDF 'img/' directory - NULL/FALSE file output print Logical; controls plot display: - TRUE: displays plot - FALSE: creates display plot Default TRUE. legend Logical; controls legend display: - TRUE: includes legend - FALSE: omits legend Default TRUE. reference Logical; controls reference panel: - TRUE: includes reference citations panel (requires Reference column) - FALSE: omits reference panel Default TRUE. title Character string main plot title: - NULL/FALSE title subtitle Character string plot subtitle: - NULL/FALSE subtitle subfig_title future use; currently ignored. verbose Logical; controls information messages: - TRUE: prints processing information - FALSE: suppresses information messages Default TRUE. debug Logical; controls debugging output: - TRUE: prints detailed debugging information - FALSE: suppresses debugging information Default FALSE. size Numeric NULL; controls plot dimensions: - 1: small (10x7 inches) - 2: medium (15x7 inches) - 3: large (15x10 inches) - 4: extra large (20x10 inches) - NULL: auto-sizes based data base_size Numeric; base font size points: - Controls text size throughout plot - Must positive number Default 16.

title: Create Bar Plots with Statistical Indicators — wp_plot_bar
text: ggplot2 object containing bar plot

title: Create Bar Plots with Statistical Indicators — wp_plot_bar
text: function automatically selects appropriate plotting implementation based number indicators: Single indicator: Simple bar plot optional color grouping Statistical indicators (range, median) Flexible value year labeling Multiple indicators: Grouped bar plot Color-coded indicator Consistent statistical indicators across groups function includes multiple features customization: Automatic axis scaling formatting Flexible ordering options Statistical annotations Reference panel data sources Consistent theme across variations

title: Create Bar Plots with Statistical Indicators — wp_plot_bar
code: # Basic bar plot with single indicator data <- data.frame(   Date = rep(seq(as.Date("2000-01-01"), as.Date("2020-01-01"), by = "year"), 3),   ISO = rep(c("FRA", "DEU", "ITA"), each = 21),   Variable = "GDP Growth",   Value = rnorm(63, 2, 0.5),   Reference = "World Bank" ) wp_plot_bar(data, y_axis = "Percent") #>  [COUNTRY] Column Country added to data  #>  [CONFIG] n_countries = 3 | n_indicators = 1 | plot_type = bar  #> /!\  The following parameters are not used in bar plots and will be ignored: subfig_title, subfig_title  #>  [SUBPLOT] call 'in_plot_one_indic_bar'  #>  [ARGS] Unused arguments for function 'plot_func': subfig_title  #> Error in geom_bar(data = all_data, ggplot2::aes(x = Country, y = display_value,     fill = color_group_label), stat = "identity", width = 0.5): could not find function "geom_bar"  # Bar plot with mean values and all statistical indicators wp_plot_bar(data,            type = "Mean",            show_range = TRUE,            show_median = TRUE,            color = "Region") #>  [COUNTRY] Column Country added to data  #>  [CONFIG] n_countries = 3 | n_indicators = 1 | plot_type = bar  #> /!\  The following parameters are not used in bar plots and will be ignored: subfig_title, subfig_title  #>  [SUBPLOT] call 'in_plot_one_indic_bar'  #>  [ARGS] Unused arguments for function 'plot_func': subfig_title  #> Error in geom_bar(data = all_data, ggplot2::aes(x = Country, y = display_value,     fill = color_group_label), stat = "identity", width = 0.5): could not find function "geom_bar"  # Latest values with year labels wp_plot_bar(data,            type = "Last",            show_year = 2,            order = "Alphabetical") #>  [COUNTRY] Column Country added to data  #>  [CONFIG] n_countries = 3 | n_indicators = 1 | plot_type = bar  #> /!\  The following parameters are not used in bar plots and will be ignored: subfig_title, subfig_title  #>  [SUBPLOT] call 'in_plot_one_indic_bar'  #>  [ARGS] Unused arguments for function 'plot_func': subfig_title  #> Error in geom_bar(data = all_data, ggplot2::aes(x = Country, y = display_value,     fill = color_group_label), stat = "identity", width = 0.5): could not find function "geom_bar"  # Multiple indicators data_multi <- data.frame(   Date = rep(seq(as.Date("2000-01-01"), as.Date("2020-01-01"), by = "year"), 6),   ISO = rep(rep(c("FRA", "DEU", "ITA"), each = 21), 2),   Variable = rep(c("GDP Growth", "Inflation"), each = 63),   Value = rnorm(126, 2, 0.5),   Reference = "World Bank" ) wp_plot_bar(data_multi,            order = 1,  # Order by first indicator            show_values = "Top") #>  [COUNTRY] Column Country added to data  #>  [CONFIG] n_countries = 3 | n_indicators = 2 | plot_type = bar  #> /!\  Setting color to 'Variable' for multi-indicator bar plot  #> /!\  The following parameters are not used in bar plots and will be ignored: subfig_title, subfig_title  #>  [SUBPLOT] call 'in_plot_multi_indic_bar'  #>  [ARGS] Unused arguments for function 'plot_func': subfig_title, show_year  #>  [MAIN] Starting multi-indicator bar plot  #>  [DATA] Starting data processing  #>  [DATA] Variables found: GDP Growth, Inflation  #>  [ORDER] Ordering by variable 1 : GDP Growth  #>  [ORDER] Country order: Germany, Italy, France  #>  [DATA] Final data rows: 6  #>  [ORDER] Final country order: Germany, Italy, France  #>  [POSITION] Bar positioning: width = 0.5 space = 0.2 dodge = 0.75  #>  [COLORS] Color mapping created  #> Error in geom_bar(ggplot2::aes(fill = Variable), stat = "identity", position = position_dodge(width = position_dodge_width),     width = bar_width): could not find function "geom_bar"

what: Create Scatter Plots with Advanced Visualization Options — wp_plot_scatter
title: Create Scatter Plots with Advanced Visualization Options — wp_plot_scatter
text: Creates scatter plots comparing two variables across countries, support various visual customizations including color grouping, ISO label placement, trend lines, statistical annotations. function automatically determines appropriate plot type based number variables specified parameters.

title: Create Scatter Plots with Advanced Visualization Options — wp_plot_scatter
code: wp_plot_scatter(   data,   y_axis = NULL,   x_axis = NULL,   color = "Subregion",   ISO = "Both",   interpolation = FALSE,   spline_bw = NULL,   r_squared = 0,   r_squared_pos = "flexible",   label_nudge = 0.005,   highlight_zero = FALSE,   filename = NULL,   print = TRUE,   legend = TRUE,   reference = TRUE,   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   subfig_title = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   debug = FALSE,   no_other = TRUE,   size = 4,   base_size = 16,   common_var = TRUE )

title: Create Scatter Plots with Advanced Visualization Options — wp_plot_scatter
text: data data.frame must contain following columns: - ISO: ISO 3-letter country codes (required) - Variable: indicator names (required) - Value: numeric values (required) - Country: country names (optional, auto-generated ISO missing) - Reference: source citations (required reference=TRUE) y_axis Single string, vector strings, TRUE, FALSE, NULL: - Single string: common y-axis label plots - Vector strings: individual labels plot - TRUE: use Variable names labels - FALSE/NULL: axis labels multi-variable plots, length must match number plot panels. x_axis Similar y_axis, controls x-axis labeling: - Single string: common x-axis label plots - Vector strings: individual labels plot - TRUE: use Variable names labels - FALSE/NULL: axis labels color Controls point coloring scheme: - "Subregion": colors geographical subregion - "Region": colors continent/major region - "Center-Periphery": colors economic classification - "Hydrocarbon": colors hydrocarbon exporter/importer status - list: custom grouping named groups countries - FALSE/NULL: color grouping (points gray) Default "Subregion". ISO Controls country label display: - TRUE: replaces points ISO codes - "": shows points repelled ISO labels - FALSE/NULL: shows points Default "". interpolation Controls trend line fitting: - TRUE/"Linear": linear regression line - "Square": quadratic regression curve - "Cubic": cubic regression curve - "Spline": smoothed spline curve - FALSE: trend line Default FALSE. spline_bw Numeric value spline smoothing bandwidth: - used interpolation="Spline" - Lower values create flexible curves - NULL automatic bandwidth selection Default NULL. r_squared Controls R-squared statistic display: - 0: R-squared display - 1: shows R-squared value - 2: shows R-squared adjusted R-squared - 3: shows equation R-squared values Default 0. r_squared_pos Controls R-squared text position: - "flexible": automatically chooses best position - "topleft": fixed top-left position - "topright": fixed top-right position - "bottomleft": fixed bottom-left position - "bottomright": fixed bottom-right position Default "flexible". label_nudge Numeric value ISO label positioning: - Controls distance point label - used ISO="" - Larger values increase separation Default 0.005. highlight_zero Logical; whether add x=0 y=0 reference lines: - TRUE: adds reference lines - FALSE: reference lines Default FALSE. filename Character string saving plots: - Specify name without extension - Plots saved PNG PDF 'img/' directory - NULL/FALSE file output print Logical; controls plot display: - TRUE: displays plot - FALSE: creates display plot Default TRUE. legend Logical; controls legend display: - TRUE: includes legend - FALSE: omits legend Default TRUE. reference Logical; controls reference panel: - TRUE: includes reference citations panel (requires Reference column) - FALSE: omits reference panel Default TRUE. title Character string main plot title: - NULL/FALSE title subtitle Character string plot subtitle: - NULL/FALSE subtitle subfig_title Controls subplot titles multi-variable plots: - TRUE: uses default titles (pairs variables) - FALSE: subplot titles - Character vector: custom titles (length must match number panels) - Ignored two-variable plots Default TRUE. verbose Logical; controls information messages: - TRUE: prints processing information - FALSE: suppresses information messages Default TRUE. debug Logical; controls debugging output: - TRUE: prints detailed debugging information - FALSE: suppresses debugging information Default FALSE. no_other Logical; controls treatment unclassified countries: - TRUE: excludes countries color group - FALSE: includes unclassified countries gray Default TRUE. size Numeric NULL; controls plot dimensions: - 1: small (10x7 inches) - 2: medium (15x7 inches) - 3: large (15x10 inches) - 4: extra large (20x10 inches) - NULL: auto-sizes based data base_size Numeric; base font size points: - Controls text size throughout plot - Must positive number Default 16. common_var Controls variable pairing multi-variable plots: - TRUE: uses first variable common x-axis - Character: specified variable used common x-axis - FALSE: sequential pairing variables Default TRUE.

title: Create Scatter Plots with Advanced Visualization Options — wp_plot_scatter
text: ggplot2 object containing scatter plot(s)

title: Create Scatter Plots with Advanced Visualization Options — wp_plot_scatter
text: function automatically selects appropriate plotting implementation based number variables: Two variables: Simple scatter plot optional trend lines Color grouping region custom groups Flexible ISO code labeling options Multiple variables: Matrix scatter plots Option common x-axis variable Consistent scales formatting across panels function includes multiple features customization: Automatic axis scaling formatting Flexible color grouping options Statistical annotations (R-squared, trend lines) Reference panel data sources Consistent theme across plot types

title: Create Scatter Plots with Advanced Visualization Options — wp_plot_scatter
code: # Basic scatter plot with two variables data <- data.frame(   ISO = c("FRA", "DEU", "ITA"),   Variable = rep(c("GDP", "Inflation"), each = 3),   Value = c(2.1, 1.8, 1.5, 3.2, 2.8, 2.5),   Reference = "World Bank" ) wp_plot_scatter(data, y_axis = "Inflation Rate (%)") #>  [COUNTRY] Column Country added to data  #>  [CONFIG] n_countries = 3 | n_indicators = 2 | plot_type = scatter  #>  [SUBPLOT] call 'in_plot_scatter_two_vars'  #>  [ARGS] Unused arguments for function 'plot_func': subfig_title, common_var, dimensions  #>  [SCATTER] Starting two-variable scatter plot  #>  [DATA] Preparing data for scatter plot  #>  [DATA] Variables: GDP vs Inflation  #>  [LABELS] Labels created: WESTERN_EUROPE Western Europe  #>  [LEGEND] Legend items (display): Western Europe  #>  [LEGEND] plot_type = 'scatter' | legend_cols = 1' | legend_height = 1.33333333333333' | n_items = 1  #>  [ADD_REF] References: World Bank   # Scatter plot with color groups and trend line wp_plot_scatter(data,                color = "Region",                interpolation = "Linear",                r_squared = 2) #>  [COUNTRY] Column Country added to data  #>  [CONFIG] n_countries = 3 | n_indicators = 2 | plot_type = scatter  #>  [SUBPLOT] call 'in_plot_scatter_two_vars'  #>  [ARGS] Unused arguments for function 'plot_func': subfig_title, common_var, dimensions  #>  [SCATTER] Starting two-variable scatter plot  #>  [DATA] Preparing data for scatter plot  #>  [DATA] Variables: GDP vs Inflation  #>  [LABELS] Labels created: EUROPE Europe  #>  [LEGEND] Legend items (display): Europe  #>  [LEGEND] plot_type = 'scatter' | legend_cols = 1' | legend_height = 1.33333333333333' | n_items = 1  #>  [ADD_REF] References: World Bank   # Multiple variables with common x-axis data_multi <- data.frame(   ISO = rep(c("FRA", "DEU", "ITA"), 3),   Variable = rep(c("GDP", "Inflation", "Debt"), each = 3),   Value = runif(9, 0, 5),   Reference = "World Bank" ) wp_plot_scatter(data_multi,                common_var = "GDP",                color = "Subregion",                ISO = "Both") #>  [COUNTRY] Column Country added to data  #>  [CONFIG] n_countries = 3 | n_indicators = 3 | plot_type = scatter  #>  [SUBPLOT] call 'in_plot_scatter_multi_vars'  #>  [ARGS] Unused arguments for function 'plot_func': r_squared_pos, no_other, dimensions  #> Using variables from data: GDP, Inflation, Debt #>  [SCATTER] Starting two-variable scatter plot  #>  [DATA] Preparing data for scatter plot  #>  [DATA] Variables: Inflation vs GDP  #>  [LABELS] Labels created: WESTERN_EUROPE Western Europe  #>  [SCATTER] Starting two-variable scatter plot  #>  [DATA] Preparing data for scatter plot  #>  [DATA] Variables: Debt vs GDP  #>  [LABELS] Labels created: WESTERN_EUROPE Western Europe  #>  [LEGEND] Legend items (display): Western Europe  #>  [LEGEND] plot_type = 'scatter' | legend_cols = 1' | legend_height = 1.33333333333333' | n_items = 1  #>  [ADD_REF] References: World Bank   # Custom color grouping color_groups <- list(   "Core" = c("DEU", "FRA"),   "Periphery" = c("ITA", "ESP") ) wp_plot_scatter(data,                color = color_groups,                highlight_zero = TRUE) #>  [COUNTRY] Column Country added to data  #>  [CONFIG] n_countries = 3 | n_indicators = 2 | plot_type = scatter  #>  [COLOR] Validating color list  #> /!\  Countries not found in data for group 'Core': DEU, FRA  #> /!\  Countries not found in data for group 'Periphery': ITA, ESP  #>  [SUBPLOT] call 'in_plot_scatter_two_vars'  #>  [ARGS] Unused arguments for function 'plot_func': subfig_title, common_var, dimensions  #>  [SCATTER] Starting two-variable scatter plot  #>  [DATA] Preparing data for scatter plot  #>  [DATA] Variables: GDP vs Inflation  #>  [LABELS] Labels created: Group A Core; Group B Periphery  #>  [LEGEND] Legend items (display): Core, Periphery  #>  [LEGEND] plot_type = 'scatter' | legend_cols = 2' | legend_height = 1.33333333333333' | n_items = 2  #>  [ADD_REF] References: World Bank

what: Create Time Series Plots with Multiple Configuration Options — wp_plot_series
title: Create Time Series Plots with Multiple Configuration Options — wp_plot_series
text: Creates time series plots support single multiple indicators, single multiple countries, stacked area plots, dual axes, various visual customizations (e.g., references legend). function automatically determines appropriate plot type based input data structure specified parameters.

title: Create Time Series Plots with Multiple Configuration Options — wp_plot_series
code: wp_plot_series(   data,   y_axis = NULL,   right_axis = NULL,   key_dates = NULL,   area = FALSE,   by_indicator = NULL,   filename = NULL,   print = TRUE,   legend = TRUE,   reference = TRUE,   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   subfig_title = NULL,   verbose = TRUE,   debug = FALSE,   size = NULL,   base_size = 16 )

title: Create Time Series Plots with Multiple Configuration Options — wp_plot_series
text: data data.frame must contain following columns: - ISO: ISO 3-letter country codes (required) - Date: dates Date format (required) - Variable: indicator names (required) - Value: numeric values (required) - Country: country names (optional, auto-generated ISO missing) - Reference: source citations (required reference=TRUE) y_axis Single string, vector strings, TRUE, FALSE, NULL: - Single string: common y-axis label plots - Vector strings: individual labels plot/axis - TRUE: use Variable names labels - FALSE/NULL: axis labels dual axis plots, must vector length 2 left right axes. multi-indicator plots, length must match number indicators. right_axis controls right y-axis behavior: - NULL/FALSE: right axis (default) - TRUE: automatically assigns variables right axis based scale - character vector: names variables assign right axis available plots 2 indicators. used area=TRUE. key_dates data.frame marking significant events: - Must exactly 2 columns - Column 1: event descriptions - Column 2: corresponding dates Date format - Events outside plot date range automatically filtered - NULL event markers area logical; TRUE, creates stacked area plot: - single-country, multi-indicator plots - First variable shown line top stacked areas - used right_axis=TRUE Default FALSE. by_indicator logical; controls faceting multi-panel plots: - TRUE: creates separate panels indicator - FALSE: creates separate panels country - Ignored single country single indicator plots Default TRUE. filename character string saving plots: - Specify name without extension - Plots saved PNG PDF 'img/' directory - NULL/FALSE file output print logical; controls plot display: - TRUE: displays plot - FALSE: creates display plot Default TRUE. legend logical; controls legend display: - TRUE: includes legend - FALSE: omits legend Default TRUE. reference logical; controls reference panel: - TRUE: includes reference citations panel (requires Reference column) - FALSE: omits reference panel - Automatically set FALSE Reference column missing/empty Default TRUE. title character string main plot title: - NULL/FALSE title subtitle character string plot subtitle: - NULL/FALSE subtitle subfig_title controls subplot titles multi-panel plots: - TRUE: uses default titles (Variable Country names) - FALSE: subplot titles - Character vector: custom titles (length must match number panels) - Ignored single panel plots Default TRUE. verbose logical; controls information messages: - TRUE: prints processing information - FALSE: suppresses information messages Default TRUE. debug logical; controls debugging output: - TRUE: prints detailed debugging information - FALSE: suppresses debugging information Default FALSE. size numeric NULL; controls plot dimensions: - 1: small (10x7 inches) - 2: medium (15x7 inches) - 3: large (15x10 inches) - 4: extra large (20x10 inches) - NULL: auto-sizes based data base_size numeric; base font size points: - Controls text size throughout plot - Must positive number - Default 16

title: Create Time Series Plots with Multiple Configuration Options — wp_plot_series
text: ggplot2 object containing time series plot

title: Create Time Series Plots with Multiple Configuration Options — wp_plot_series
text: function automatically selects appropriate plotting implementation based data structure parameters: Single country, multiple indicators: Basic line plot (default) Stacked area plot (area = TRUE) Dual axis plot (right_axis specified) Multiple countries, single indicator: Multi-line plot color-coded countries Multiple countries, multiple indicators: Faceted plot indicator (by_indicator = TRUE) Faceted plot country (by_indicator = FALSE) function includes multiple features customization: Automatic axis scaling formatting Event markers customizable labels Reference panel data sources Flexible legend positioning Consistent theme across plot types

title: Create Time Series Plots with Multiple Configuration Options — wp_plot_series
code: # Basic time series for one country and multiple indicators data <- data.frame(   Date = rep(seq(as.Date("2000-01-01"), as.Date("2020-01-01"), by = "year"), 2),   ISO = "FRA",   Variable = rep(c("GDP", "Inflation"), each = 21),   Value = c(rnorm(21, 2, 0.5), rnorm(21, 3, 1)),   Reference = "World Bank" ) wp_plot_series(data, y_axis = "Percent") #>  [COUNTRY] Column Country added to data  #>  [CONFIG] n_countries = 1 | n_indicators = 2 | plot_type = series  #>  [SUBPLOT] call 'in_plot_multi_indic_one_ctry'  #>  [ARGS] Unused arguments for function 'plot_func': subfig_title, right_axis, area, by_indicator, dimensions  #> Warning: Using `as.character()` on a quosure is deprecated as of rlang 0.3.0. Please use #> `as_label()` or `as_name()` instead. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #>  [LEGEND] Legend items (display): GDP, Inflation  #>  [LEGEND] plot_type = 'series' | legend_cols = 2' | legend_height = 1.33333333333333' | n_items = 2  #>  [ADD_REF] References: World Bank   # Dual axis plot with manual axis assignment wp_plot_series(data,                 y_axis = c("GDP Growth (%)", "Inflation (%)"),                right_axis = "Inflation") #>  [COUNTRY] Column Country added to data  #>  [CONFIG] n_countries = 1 | n_indicators = 2 | plot_type = series  #>  [SUBPLOT] call 'in_plot_multi_indic_one_ctry_two_axes'  #>  [ARGS] Unused arguments for function 'plot_func': subfig_title, area, by_indicator, dimensions  #>  [LEGEND] Legend items (display): GDP, Inflation  #>  [LEGEND] plot_type = 'series' | legend_cols = 2' | legend_height = 1.33333333333333' | n_items = 2  #>  [ADD_REF] References: World Bank   # Stacked area plot wp_plot_series(data,                 y_axis = "Percent",                area = TRUE) #>  [COUNTRY] Column Country added to data  #>  [CONFIG] n_countries = 1 | n_indicators = 2 | plot_type = series  #>  [SUBPLOT] call 'in_plot_one_ctry_area'  #>  [ARGS] Unused arguments for function 'plot_func': subfig_title, right_axis, area, by_indicator, dimensions  #> Warning: Duplicated aesthetics after name standardisation: fill #>  [LEGEND] Legend items (display): GDP, Inflation  #>  [LEGEND] plot_type = 'series' | legend_cols = 2' | legend_height = 2.33333333333333' | n_items = 2  #>  [ADD_REF] References: World Bank   # Multiple countries with event markers data_multi <- data.frame(   Date = rep(seq(as.Date("2000-01-01"), as.Date("2020-01-01"), by = "year"), 4),   ISO = rep(c("FRA", "DEU"), each = 42),   Variable = rep(rep(c("GDP", "Inflation"), each = 21), 2),   Value = rnorm(84, 2, 0.5),   Reference = "World Bank" ) events <- data.frame(   Event = c("Financial Crisis", "Euro Crisis"),   Date = as.Date(c("2008-09-15", "2010-05-01")) ) wp_plot_series(data_multi,                y_axis = "Percent",                key_dates = events,                by_indicator = TRUE) #>  [COUNTRY] Column Country added to data  #>  [CONFIG] n_countries = 2 | n_indicators = 2 | plot_type = series  #>  [SUBPLOT] call 'in_plot_multi_by_indic'  #>  [ARGS] Unused arguments for function 'plot_func': right_axis, area, by_indicator, dimensions  #>  [DATES] add key dates  #>  [DATES] add key dates  #>  [LEGEND] Legend items (display): France, Germany  #>  [LEGEND] plot_type = 'series' | legend_cols = 2' | legend_height = 1.33333333333333' | n_items = 2  #>  [ADD_REF] References: World Bank
